name: Causal Inference Problems
description: Causal reasoning, correlation vs causation, and intervention prediction

problems.description: Ice cream sales and drowning deaths both increase in summer. Does ice cream cause drowning?

input.observation: Ice cream sales correlate with drowning deaths
input.question: Does ice cream cause drowning?

problems.description: Students who take notes on laptops score lower than those using pen and paper. Should we ban laptops to improve scores?

input.observation: Laptop users score lower

problems.description: Countries with more fire trucks have more fires. Do fire trucks cause fires?

input.observation: Fire trucks correlate with fires
input.question: Do fire trucks cause fires?

problems.description: Smoking correlates with lung cancer. Does smoking cause lung cancer?

input.observation: Smokers have higher lung cancer rates
input.question: Does smoking cause lung cancer?

problems.description: You observe: studying increases test scores. If we force all students to study 2 more hours, what happens to average scores?

input.observation: Study time correlates with test scores (r=0.6)
input.intervention: Increase study time by 2 hours for all students

problems.description: Exercise correlates with health. But healthier people exercise more. What is the causal relationship?

input.observation: Exercise and health correlate
input.question: Direction of causation?

problems.description: Education correlates with income. Is this causal? What confounds exist?

input.observation: More education correlates with higher income
input.question: Causal or confounded?

problems.description: Counterfactual: If you hadn't studied, would you have passed the exam? (You studied and passed)
Vitamin C intake correlates with lower cold duration. Does vitamin C reduce cold duration?

input.observation: Vitamin C users have shorter colds (on average)
input.question: Does vitamin C cause shorter colds?

problems.description: Rooster crows before sunrise every day. Does the rooster cause the sun to rise?

input.observation: Rooster crowing precedes sunrise (100% correlation)
input.question: Does rooster crowing cause sunrise?

problems.description: Shoe size correlates with reading ability in children. Do bigger feet cause better reading?

input.observation: Children with larger shoe sizes read better
input.question: Does shoe size cause reading ability?

problems.description: Hospitals with more patients tend to have more deaths. Should we close large hospitals to reduce deaths?

input.observation: Hospital size correlates with death count
input.question: Will this reduce deaths?

problems.description: Employees who work from home are less productive. Does remote work cause reduced productivity?

input.observation: Remote workers have 15% lower output
input.question: Does working from home cause lower productivity?

problems.description: Meditation reduces stress. But stressed people seek meditation. What is the causal direction?

input.observation: People who meditate report lower stress
input.question: Does meditation reduce stress, or do low-stress people meditate more?

metadata.mechanism: stress drives meditation seeking; meditation reduces stress

problems.description: If we increase police presence in high-crime areas, will crime decrease?

input.observation: Areas with more police have more arrests
input.intervention: Double police presence in high-crime neighborhoods
input.question: Predict effect on crime rate

problems.description: Coffee consumption correlates with heart disease. But coffee drinkers also smoke more. Is coffee harmful?

input.observation: Coffee drinkers have 20% higher heart disease rates
input.confounder: Smoking prevalence higher among coffee drinkers
input.question: Does coffee cause heart disease?

problems.description: People who take vitamins are healthier. But they also exercise more and eat better. What is the causal path?

input.observation: Vitamin users have better health outcomes
input.question: Direct effect of vitamins, or mediated by lifestyle?

problems.description: Counterfactual: Company revenue dropped 30% after hiring a new CEO. If they had kept the old CEO, would revenue have dropped?

input.context: Economic recession began same quarter as CEO change

problems.description: Elite college graduates earn more. Does attending an elite college cause higher earnings?

input.observation: Elite college grads earn 40% more on average
input.question: Causal effect of elite college attendance?
input.evidence: Students accepted to elite colleges who chose state schools earn similarly to elite grads

problems.description: Social media use correlates with depression in teens. Does social media cause depression?

input.observation: Heavy social media users report higher depression rates
input.question: Direction of causation?

problems.description: Among hospitalized patients, those who receive flowers recover faster. Should hospitals provide flowers to all patients?

input.observation: Patients with flowers in their room recover 2 days faster on average
input.question: Will recovery times improve?

problems.description: Red wine consumption correlates with longevity. Does red wine extend lifespan?

input.observation: Moderate red wine drinkers live 3 years longer on average
input.question: Does red wine cause longevity?
